page.title: 13PORT ELIOT ESTATE-INTERVIEW
page.content: {Lord Peregrine Eliot,}has lived on the {Port Eliot Estate}all his life and is the eldest son of the previous Lord Eliot.The{Port Eliot Estate}consists of 6000 acres,of this total amount 900 acres is woodland.Of this 900 acres most is leased to 19 tenant farmers,the biggest of these being {Markwell.}All of this land is involed in agricultural development.The{Estate also contains the confluence of the{ {River Lynher}and the{River Tiddy}both of which are used for salmon fishing. Quite a bit of{St.Germans}including the railway station and the church is in the{Estate}but privately owned. When asked if the church payed rent he replied,"God has his house in my garden but he doesn't pay rent". There is a saw mill,a builders yard and a working quay in the grounds that are run by tenants.
